availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Michael Foley (Kentucky, soldier and railroad worker)

body.p: Kentucky, soldier and railroad worker. Ireland native. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from August 22, 1862 to August 21, 1863. Worked on the Lebanon Branch of the Louisville and Nashville Railroad in December 1864. Charged for the murder of Merritt Dicken by the Marion County Court in December 1864 and pardoned by Governor Thomas Elliott Bramlette on December 21, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 96.
KYR-0001-004-1380.
